title: Former NASA astronaut Leland Melvin was never afraid to go to space. But a police stop made him sweat
description: A police stop could have cost former NASA astronaut Leland Melvin his career in space before he ever got started.

title: Bronze Age Britons kept human remains on display in their homes
description: People living in Bronze Age Britain kept human remains as relics and even crafted them into musical instruments, a new study has suggested.

title: Dr. Birx to Americans: Wear a mask -- even around family
description: Just over seven months ago, no one in the US had a confirmed case of Covid-19. On Monday, the US topped 6 million cases of coronavirus, which has killed over 183,000 people and left many young adults with long-term problems.

title: Wedding announcement goes viral after groom's ex publicly reveals he cheated on her when he met the bride
description: When Nikyta Moreno saw her ex-husband in the New York Times' Wedding section, it came with a startling realization: He had been cheating on her. Now, after publishing her side of the story, the internet has her back.

title: How 'Cobra Kai' went from obscurity to No. 1 on Netflix
description: After languishing in relative obscurity on YouTube Red, the "Karate Kid" spinoff "Cobra Kai" has become one of the fastest-rising series on streaming. That's the power of Netflix.

title: Porn star Ron Jeremy faces 20 more sexual assault charges
description: Porn star Ron Jeremy is facing an additional 20 counts of forcible rape, sexual battery, sodomy and more, according to the Los Angeles District Attorney's Office.

title: Former Indian president dies at 84
description: Former Indian president Pranab Mukherjee has died at the age of 84, according to a tweet from his son.

title: US coronavirus task force reports reveal dire reality shown to Trump as he spewed positive message
Denzel Washington, who once paid Chadwick Boseman's tuition, pays tribute
description: Chadwick Boseman was referred to as "the next Denzel Washington" and the first one has remembered Boseman as a "gentle soul."

title: As Trump was painting a rosy picture of the pandemic, he was getting increasingly dire reports in July and August
description: As President Donald Trump was painting a  positive picture of the coronavirus pandemic and urging states to reopen the nation's businesses and schools, data from the White House coronavirus task force released Monday shows he was getting increasingly dire reports about the spread of the pandemic in July and August.

title: French prosecutor opens official investigation into magazine's portrayal of Black lawmaker as slave
description: The Paris prosecutor's office has opened an investigation over illustrations in a right-wing magazine that portrayed Black politician Danièle Obono as an 18th-century slave.

title: Channing Tatum wrote a children's book and dedicated it to his daughter
description: Channing Tatum is releasing his first children's book, "The One and Only Sparkella," dedicated to his 6-year-old daughter, Everly.

title: Biden condemns violence and asks Americans: 'Do you really feel safe under Donald Trump?'
Rare 'singing' dog, thought to be extinct in wild for 50 years, still thrives
description: This dog can sing ... or at least it can yodel.

title: The 10 US Senate seats most likely to flip in 2020
Portland protest shooting death: Here's what we know
'Hotel Rwanda' film hero Paul Rusesabagina arrested
description: Paul Rusesabagina, who saved hundreds of Rwandans during the genocide by sheltering them in the hotel he managed, and saw his story made into the Hollywood film 'Hotel Rwanda', has been arrested on terror related offenses, Rwandan authorities announced.

title: Amazon completes critical step toward drone delivery
description: Amazon received a critical certificate from the Federal Aviation Administration on Saturday, bringing it a step closer to launching drone delivery in the United States.

title: Lionel Messi fails to attend Barcelona pre-season training
description: Barcelona forward Lionel Messi did not attend pre-season training on Monday, a club source has confirmed to CNN Sport.

title: House Republican No. 2 deletes doctored video of activist after Twitter flags it
description: Twitter labeled a video promoted by House Minority Whip Steve Scalise of a progressive activist interviewing Joe Biden about police funding "manipulated content," and Scalise later deleted the tweet Sunday night.

title: Woman arrested for 'obscene' nude video on Indian holy bridge
description: A 27-year-old Frenchwoman has been arrested for making a nude video of herself on a holy bridge over India's Ganges River.

title: With Canada and Mexico borders closed, Americans are trapped in their own healthcare system
description: "Want to hear the joke about insulin?" goes the bleak gag about America's drug prices. "You have to go to Canada to get it."

title: McDonald's strikes back against former CEO
description: McDonald's isn't backing down from its push to claw back millions of dollars in severance pay from its former CEO, Steve Easterbrook.

title: First Israeli commercial flight between Israel and UAE takes to the skies
description: The first Israeli commercial flight from Israel to the United Arab Emirates (UAE) took to the skies on Monday, after an agreement to normalize relations between the two countries.

title: Trump keeps wrongly describing Biden's shutdown comments
description: President Donald Trump keeps wrongly describing what his Democratic opponent, former Vice President Joe Biden, said about the idea of imposing a "shutdown" to combat the coronavirus.

title: This young fashion brand is tackling two of fashion's biggest issues head-on
description: London-based designer Priya Ahluwalia uses her eponymous fashion label to explore her Indian and Nigerian heritage and tackle fashion's colossal waste problem.

title: North Korea faces dangerous triple threat
description: In a rare move, North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has raised alarm over three crisis facing the country; sanctions, the coronavirus pandemic and a looming typhoon. The urgent calls come amid unusual political movements. CNN's Will Ripley reports.

title: Australian journalist and TV host detained in China
description: A prominent Australian journalist has been detained in China as tensions between the two countries rise.

title: Huge empty 'ghost' cruise ships lure tourists
description: Gaze out to the English Channel from the southwest coast of the UK right now and you might see something unexpected -- a series of gigantic cruise ships haunting the horizon.

title: New Chinese rules could complicate a sale of TikTok's US business
description: China appears to have complicated efforts to sell TikTok to an American company by introducing new rules that could allow Beijing to veto any potential deal.

title: The country with the fastest growing caseload in the world
description:
• Live updates: US surpasses 6 million cases
• New task force reports show dire reality Trump saw while spewing positivity

title: Pro tennis divided by launch of breakaway players' association
description: Tennis has been left divided following the launch of a breakaway players' association, with Roger Fereder and Rafael Nadal among those to criticize its formation.

title: New premier named in Lebanon hours before Macron's visit
description: Lebanon's leaders have designated the country's ambassador to Germany, Mustapha Adib, as the new premier, hours before the arrival of French President Emmanuel Macron in Beirut.

title: This young entrepreneur skipped college to create robotic limbs that users can control with their minds
description: Ten years ago, Easton LaChappelle was a teen watching YouTube videos in his Colorado bedroom on how to build robot arms from LEGOs.

title: Town bills teen $2,500 for police overtime due to Black Lives Matter protest she organized
description: A New Jersey teen organized a Black Lives Matter and affordable housing protest on July 25, over what she says is a lack of affordable housing that disproportionately prevents Black people, Native Americans, and other people of color from living in Englewood Cliffs, New Jersey.

title: The 10 US Senate seats most likely to flip in 2020
description:
• Analysis: This is the widest presidential battleground in a very long time
• Biden asks America: 'Do you really feel safer under Trump?'

title: Elites are flouting coronavirus restrictions -- and that could hurt us all
How schools are running gym class in pandemic times
This 7-year-old boy held a heartbreaking memorial for Chadwick Boseman, who played his favorite superhero
description: When 7-year-old Kian Westbrook learned that Chadwick Boseman, the actor who played his favorite superhero, had died, he immediately began crying.

title: Can China look past counterfeits and superstition in its burgeoning second-hand fashion market?
description: China may produce and consume more apparel than anywhere else in the world, but when it comes to buying pre-owned clothes, the country lags behind fashion's other major players.

title: Biden and Trump to duel over race and violence in defining moment in 2020 campaign
description: Democratic nominee Joe Biden and President Donald Trump are going head-to-head on the hyper-sensitive issues of civic violence and racial justice in a potentially defining moment for a suddenly electrified battle for the White House.

title: Angel City: Disruptors plan Hollywood ending for LA women's soccer club
description: For Alexis Ohanian last summer, it started with a simple phone call. The entrepreneur and co-founder of Reddit was in London and his friend wanted him to come to Paris, "He's like, you're an idiot if you don't come down to watch the USA play France."

title: Champagne makers are throwing out grapes. Here's why
description: The 2020 champagne harvest is underway with a promising output but champagne producers have agreed to throw out much of the harvest to keep the prices high to compensate for the drop in demand due to the Covid-19 pandemic. CNN's Melissa Bell explains.

title: Nuggets star says shoes with images of Breonna Taylor and George Floyd 'give me life' after scoring 50 points
description: After scoring 50 points in a must-win game, Denver Nuggets guard Jamal Murray thanked his shoes -- with an image of George Floyd on one and Breonna Taylor on the other.

title: Here's what we know about the Portland protest shooting death
description: More than a day after a man was shot and killed in downtown Portland Saturday night, as President Donald Trump supporters clashed with protesters against police, few details have emerged about what took place.

title: Watch Elon Musk show how the Neuralink brain implant works — using a pig
description: A pig named Gertrude was the star of the show when Elon Musk debuted a working demo of his latest technology moonshot, a new kind of implantable chip for the brain.

title: Here's why Adele was wearing Bantu knots, a Jamaican flag bikini top and other carnival wear
description: Adele caused quite the stir on social media Sunday after posting a picture of herself on Instagram wearing Bantu knots, a Jamaican flag bikini top and other carnival wear popular in Afro-Caribbean cultures.

title: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway makes big bets on Japan
description: Warren Buffett is ushering in his nineties with big bets on Japan.

title: A child in Taiwan was caught in a kite and swept high into the air
description: A kite-flying festival turned terrifying in Taiwan on Sunday when a 3-year-old girl became entangled in tail of giant kite and sent flying high into the air.

title: How Diana became known as 'the people's princess'
description: In 1995, two years before Diana, Princess of Wales died in a car crash in Paris, she said in a TV interview that she'd like to be a queen. But she wasn't talking about the British monarchy into which she'd married. She wanted to be a queen of people's hearts.

title: MTV VMAs 2020: Lady Gaga, The Weeknd and more take home awards
How Shinzo Abe's exit could threaten regional stability and Japan's alliance with the US
description: Rumors concerning Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe's health had circulated for weeks, and while his resignation on Friday could not have come as a complete shock to United States officials, the timing of the announcement is worrisome.

title: Stelter: America's problems are real, but the news coverage needs to keep it in proportion
description: A version of this article first appeared in the "Reliable Sources" newsletter. You can sign up for free right here.

title: One shot of coronavirus vaccine likely won't be enough
description: When a coronavirus vaccine comes on the market, people will likely need two doses, not just one -- and that could cause real problems.

title: Portland mayor blasts Trump for 'hate and vitriol'
description: The Democratic mayor of Portland, Oregon, said Sunday it is President Donald Trump who "created the hate" in an unyielding attack on the White House following a shooting at a protest that left one person dead.

title: White House says Trump still planning to visit Kenosha after governor urges him to reconsider
description: President Donald Trump is still planning to visit Kenosha, Wisconsin, this week after Democratic Wisconsin Gov. Tony Evers wrote him a letter urging that he reconsider as the city continues to grapple with racial unrest following the police shooting of Jacob Blake.

title: Axios: Trump offered FBI director job to John Kelly if he pledged loyalty
description: President Donald Trump offered then-Homeland Security secretary John Kelly the position of FBI director one day after he fired James Comey in 2017, but demanded that he be loyal, according to an Axios report citing New York Times reporter Michael Schmidt's forthcoming book.

title: 10-year-old challenges rock legend Dave Grohl to drum battle
description: Prodigious drummer Nandi Bushell loves the Foo Fighters and the band's frontman accepted her online challenge.

title: Biden condemns violence in Portland, calls on Trump to do same
description: Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden is forcefully condemning the violent protests that took one life in Portland on Saturday evening, calling on President Donald Trump to do the same.
